meanings.definition: A small piece of metal or plastic used to hold things together or in place.
meanings.sent1: I used a clip to hold my papers together.
meanings.sent2: She put a clip in her hair to keep it from falling in her face.
meanings.sent3: The clip on the bag broke, and all the groceries spilled out!
meanings.sent4: His words were like a clip to my heart, leaving me feeling exposed.
meanings.sent5: The clip gleamed in the sunlight, a tiny hero keeping order in chaos.

meanings.definition: To cut something short with scissors or shears.
meanings.sent1: I need to clip my nails before they get too long.
meanings.sent2: She decided to clip the bushes in the garden to make them look neat.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally tried to clip the wrong wire, causing a small explosion.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to clip by as they laughed and talked late into the night.
meanings.sent5: The barber would deftly clip away at the hair, transforming each head into a work of art.

meanings.definition: A short extract from a film or video.
meanings.sent1: I watched a clip of the new movie on my phone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher showed a clip from a documentary to illustrate her point.
meanings.sent3: The funny clip made everyone in the room burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The clip of the car chase was so intense, it felt like I was in the movie.
meanings.sent5: The clip of the sunset was so beautiful, it brought tears to my eyes.

meanings.definition: To fasten or attach something with a clip.
meanings.sent1: She needed to clip the microphone onto her shirt before going on stage.
meanings.sent2: He used a clip to attach the photo to the bulletin board.
meanings.sent3: The magician clipped the card to his sleeve, ready for a surprise trick.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to clip onto his heart, making him feel understood.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to clip the safety harness before stepping out into space.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful clip to his opponent's jaw.
meanings.sent2: The tree branch gave a sharp clip to my shoulder as I walked by.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clip on the head left him seeing stars.
meanings.sent4: His words had a sharp clip to them, making her realize the truth.
meanings.sent5: The clip of thunder echoed through the valley, shaking the ground beneath our feet.
